definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove

sentences.english: China will unswervingly carry out its independent foreign policy of peace in a comprehensive manner.
sentences.chinese: 中国将坚定不移地综合执行和平独立的外交政策。

sentences.english: Fifth, I am unalterably opposed to governmental censorship.
sentences.chinese: 第五，我坚定不移地反对政府检查制度。

sentences.english: Microsoft, for instance, remains firmly attached to its Windows operating system (see article).
sentences.chinese: 比如微软就依然坚定不移地死守视窗操作系统。

sentences.english: She had a natural courtesy combined with an unshakable conviction.
sentences.chinese: 她既有天生的谦恭有礼的举止，又有坚定不移的信念。

sentences.english: The United States is committed to defending religious freedom around the world.” --Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton
sentences.chinese: 美国坚定不移地捍卫世界各地的宗教自由。

sentences.english: I'm extremely annoyed by "must staunchly implement" or something.
sentences.chinese: 我最烦那个“要坚定不移地贯彻”什么了。

sentences.english: We will pursue an innovation-driven development strategy to create stronger growth drivers.
sentences.chinese: 坚定不移实施创新驱动发展战略，释放更强增长动力。

sentences.english: It is steadfastness and courage and hope.
sentences.chinese: 它代表坚定不移，勇气及希望。

sentences.english: First, we will firmly press ahead with the shareholding reform of state-owned commercial banks.
sentences.chinese: 一是坚定不移地推进国有商业银行股份制改革。

sentences.english: Common people are different, they have no their own principle of practice, and their practice in soundness, tranquilness and peace are not enough.
sentences.chinese: 修行完备的人，在个人的修习上是坚定不移的。

sentences.english: Life with her, stand proudly adamantine belief.
sentences.chinese: 生命傲然挺立，全以她坚定不移的信念。

sentences.english: We should stick to the Whole-nation System.
sentences.chinese: 指出必须坚定不移地坚持举国体制。

sentences.english: If the affair is known or strongly suspected, you’re better off telling.
sentences.chinese: 如果偷情被知道或坚定不移地怀疑，你最好还是坦白。

sentences.english: We will stride forward unswervingly along this road.
sentences.chinese: 我们将沿着这条道路坚定不移地奋勇前进。

sentences.english: This means the officials must be firm, decisive and unshakeable.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着裁判员必须是强硬的，果断的和坚定不移的。

sentences.english: I brought injury, perseverance and watchful along the tears.
sentences.chinese: 我带着伤坚定不移的前行，沿路洒满泪滴。

definition: to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to show one's colors/to have a clear-cut stand (idiom)
to chip away at a task and not abandon it (idiom); to chisel away at sth/to persevere/unflagging efforts
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
just as in the past (idiom); as before/continuing as always
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
